intro: Leontice leontopetalum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides. The plant features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical characteristics include a sprawling growth habit and a fibrous root system. The plant is often considered a weed due to its aggressive spreading nature.
